wikipedia_page.main: Air Vice Marshal Sir Robert Allingham George,  (27 July 1896 – 13 September 1967) was a senior officer in the Royal Air Force and Governor of South Australia from 23 February 1953 until 7 March 1960. He was born in the County of Ross and Cromarty, Scotland, on 27 July 1896, and educated at Invergordon and Inverness. In May 1927, he married Sybil Elizabeth Baldwin.

response: *1896 – Robert George, Scottish air marshal and politician, 24th Governor of South Australia (d. 1967)
*  1967   – Robert George, English air marshal and politician, 24th Governor of South Australia (b. 1896)
* 25 August – Robert George (born 1896), Governor of South Australia

*1952–1955: Robert George – In 1954 the Government commenced renovation of both viceregal residences. The original acetylene gas lighting at Marble Hill was replaced, at considerable expense, with electricity. Sir Robert and Lady George's possessions were moved to Marble Hill while Government House was being renovated. Marble Hill was to have been renovated the following year.
